books.title: The Comedy of Errors
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two sets of identical twins are mistaken for their lost siblings.

books.title: The Son of the Wolf
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A collection of stories entailing life during the gold rush in the harsh wilderness of northwestern North America.

books.title: The Story of My Life
books.author: Helen Keller
books.summary: Helen Keller writes about her experiences as a deafblind child learning to communicate.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Wonderful Adventures of Nils
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: Nils Holgersson, transformed to an elf, learns the meaning of kindness during his adventures with a flock of wild geese.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.

books.title: The Seagull
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A has-been actress, her ambitious playwright son, a male writer, and an aspiring young actress struggle to realize their romantic and artistic aims.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: A collection of E. M. Forster’s short stories, ordered by date of their original publication.

books.title: The End of the Tether
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An aging captain, having made a name for himself in the age of sail, is forced by circumstance to do a final run on a steamer.

books.title: John Silence Stories
books.author: Algernon Blackwood
books.summary: A physician turned detective uses his psychic abilities to solve the strange cases presented to him.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: Call Mr. Fortune
books.author: H. C. Bailey
books.summary: A medically-qualified detective tackles mysteries ranging from a failed assassination to incidents at an all-girls school.

books.title: Liberalism
books.author: L. T. Hobhouse
books.summary: An early twentieth century description of the philosophy of liberal socialism.

books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: Eugene Onegin
books.author: Alexander Pushkin
books.summary: A jaded Russian fop’s disdain for the world catches up with him.

books.title: Main Street
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: An ambitious young woman chafes against the constraints of small-town America.

books.title: Gladiator
books.author: Philip Wylie
books.summary: A young man, given superhuman abilities by his scientist father, tries to find purpose and use for his powers.

books.title: Nonsense Books
books.author: Edward Lear
books.summary: A collection of literary nonsense in the forms of limericks, songs, and short stories.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
